properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A hot and humid air mass will remain over the area today. Temperatures in the low thirties are expected this afternoon, with humidex values in the upper thirties. A slightly cooler and less humid air mass will arrive in the wake of a cold front this evening providing relief from the heat into Friday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-12T00:46:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T08:47:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2390977250.2019
Area: Gatineau, Merrickville-Wolford - Kemptville, Westport - Charleston Lake, Brockville - Prescott, Gananoque - Mallorytown, Maxville - Alexandria, Cornwall - Lancaster, Winchester - Newington, Morrisburg - Long Sault, Prescott and Russell, Ottawa North - Kanata - Orl√©ans, Ottawa South - Richmond - Metcalfe
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:21 a.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-11T10:20:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T07:21:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2611147384.2019
Area: Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake, South River - Burk's Falls, Bayfield Inlet - Dunchurch, Town of Parry Sound - Rosseau - Killbear Park, Port Carling - Port Severn, New Liskeard - Temagami, West Nipissing - French River, North Bay - Powassan - Mattawa
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: This afternoon and early this evening, conditions will be favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts and heavy downpours. Boaters could be surprised by these gusts over bodies of water. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T20:44:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T08:45:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1382171475.2019

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution due to smoke from forest fires will continue tonight for a large part of Northern Ontario. Smoke plumes are moving over the region from several forest fires located in the Sandy Lake - Pikangikum region. There are also additional smaller fires in Northeastern Ontario. Air quality may deteriorate if the smoke descends to ground level. If you or those in your care are exposed to wildfire smoke, consider taking extra precautions to reduce your exposure. Wildfire smoke is a constantly-changing mixture of particles and gasses which includes many chemicals that can harm your health. For more details, please consult www.canada.ca/en/environment-climate-change/services/air-quality-health-index/wildfire-smoke.html. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-07-11T21:59:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-07-11T07:28:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0717053775.2019
Area: Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell, Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park, Ear Falls - Perrault Falls - Western Lac Seul
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is no longer expected or has moved out of the area. ###

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Severe thunderstorms with hail as large as golf balls and strong winds exceeding 100 km/h are possible this evening. These severe thunderstorms are likely to persist into the later evening hours. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-07-11T09:14:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-07-11T02:47:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1183657420.2019

properties.Title: Amber Alert
properties.Summary:
Description: AMBER Alert in effect. York Regional Police has requested an AMBER Alert broadcast in relation to abducted children Harrison and Keegan L a r o c q u e. Harrison 2, white male, blond hair. Keegan 4, white male, brown hair. Last seen with their grandfather Leo EASTON in Newmarket, Ontario at 3:00pm on Wednesday at Upper Canada Mall. Leo is described as a 70 year old white male, 5 feet 10 inches, 160 lbs, salt and pepper hair and wearing a blue checkered shirt, khaki shorts and white shoes. Leo is driving a 2006 Blue Pontiac Montana B V B P 3 6 4 If observed call 9-1-1
Expires: 2019-07-11T08:00:00-04:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Ontario Provincial Police, 2019-07-11T03:44:41-04:00, 0B343041-DDBC-74FD-86B2-F7CDB056DA27
Area: Newmarket, Ontario

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:17 a.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 10 kilometres northeast of Balsam Creek to 10 kilometres southeast of Moon River, moving northeast at 100 km/h. Locations impacted include: Huntsville, Mattawa, MacTier, Rosseau, Burk's Falls, and South River. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-07-11T11:03:10-00:00
